result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory T Sharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges as a condition of Extended Supervision on case 2014CF3862.

Due to DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory T Sharp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING (25 pages) commencing 06/18/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Gregory T Sharp in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Gregory T Sharp in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Correction, (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF3862), with credit for 0 days time served.
.
COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges as a condition of 
   extended supervision on case 2014CF3862.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
   and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero. 
Defendant advised of right to seek postconviction relief, and appeal.  Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.    mld

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Gregory T Sharp not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-18-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Gregory T Sharp in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  District Attorney Investigator Joseph Link.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  State's motion to join 14CF3862 and 15CF1557 heard and granted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Gregory T Sharp not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant had a medical issue during lunch hour.  Defendant unable to be brought to court.  Matter adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.D.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   The Court ordered No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gregory T Sharp in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Gregory T Sharp in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Court orders DNA sample to be obtained from defendant.  Defendant advised the he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if certain conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
